TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerAction extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Associates an action taken on an activity designer on the workflow design surface with the . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
A designer action is a user action that is performed when you activate a designer glyph on the workflow design surface. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction> class is used to indicate your actions. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction> class is also used to add the task items by the adornment service.

Docs.summary: Invokes the method of the activity designer associated with the current designer action.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnExecuteDesignerAction%2A> method is called when you click a validation error displayed by the activity designer on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the property editor, the property that corresponds to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.PropertyName%2A> of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction> provides a visual cue that signals the presence of an associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction>.
